newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Hong Kong stocks seen slipping after record close.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks seen slipping after record close.

text.p: Hong Kong stocks could succumb to some profit-taking on Thursday after a late surge in prices propelled the Hang Seng index to a record close on Wednesday, but analysts expected prices to remain resilient.

"I think the market will have a small correction, probably 50 to 80 points at the opening," said Michael Ng, dealing director at Sassoon Securities. "Wall Street closed down 36 points and maybe this will affect Hong Kong at the opening."
The Hang Seng index jumped 143.81 points to a record close of 12,250.57 on Wednesday. Later, the Hang Seng London Reference index rose 18.71 points to 12,269.28.
